pr_title: Support A Well-Known URL for Changing Passwords

timeline.author: jzheaux
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -2526,6 +2527,79 @@ public HttpSecurity httpBasic(Customizer> http return HttpSecurity.this; } + /** + * Configures Well-Known URL for Changing Passwords. + * + *

Example Configuration

+ * The example below demonstrates how to configure Well-Known URL for Changing Passwords for an + * application. The default change password URL is "/change-password", but can be + * customized using {@link WellKnownChangePasswordConfigurer#changePasswordUrl(String)}. + * + * 
+	 * @Configuration
+	 * @EnableWebSecurity

+	 *
+	 * 	@Override
+	 * 	protected void configure(HttpSecurity http) throws Exception {

+	 * 			.authorizeRequests(authorizeRequests ->
+	 * 				authorizeRequests
+	 * 					.antMatchers("/**").hasRole("USER")
+	 * 			)
+	 * 			.wellKnownChangePassword();
+	 *    }
+	 * }
+	 *
+ * + * @return the {@link WellKnownChangePasswordConfigurer} for further customizations + * @throws Exception + * @see Well-Known URL for Changing Passwords + */ + public WellKnownChangePasswordConfigurer wellKnownChangePassword() throws Exception {

replies.bodyText:
Thank you for the review, @jzheaux
Yes, the passwordManagement seems to be a better option, so I'll update my PR.
replies.author: evgeniycheban

timeline.bodyText: It seems to me that the /.well-known/change-password endpoint is designed for tools to be able to discover a website's actual change password page. Given that, I think this should be earlier in the filter chain since it requires no authentication.
timeline.author: jzheaux

timeline.bodyText: Are you able to add the equivalent WebFilter and DSL support on the reactive side?
timeline.author: jzheaux

replies.bodyText: Done. I also added a sample with webflux.
replies.author: evgeniycheban

timeline.bodyText: In the public APIs that you add, please add a @since 5.4 annotation. In this case, you'd place it on the type. In existing types, place it on the public methods that you add.
timeline.author: jzheaux

timeline.bodyText: In light of the fact that there may be more web support for other password-related tasks, let's name this package web.password instead of web.wellknown.
timeline.author: jzheaux

timeline.bodyText:
I hesitate to say that any well-known URI support would go into the same package - it seems more natural to align them with their business function (e.g. password, oidc, etc.).
One thing that's nice about this is that it makes it a bit easier to share APIs in a package-private way while they are maturing into something that can be exposed as public. It appears more likely that there will be shared support between various password management classes than there will between various .well-known endpoints.
Another nice thing about it is logging - if I want to trace all password request activity, then I can do so by changing just the one package logging level. It appears more likely that an application will want to bump up logging levels for all of web.password than all of web.wellknown.
TBH, I'm a little bit on the fence, but web.password is making more sense to me.
timeline.author: jzheaux
timeline.diffHunk: @@ -0,0 +1,22 @@ +/* + * Copyright 2002-2020 the original author or authors. + * + * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); + * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. + * You may obtain a copy of the License at + * + * https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 + * + * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software + * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, + * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. + * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and + * limitations under the License. + */ +/** + * Classes which are responsible for the implementation of "well-known locations" RFC 8615. + * + * @author Evgeniy Cheban + * @see RFC 8615 + */ +package org.springframework.security.web.wellknown;

timeline.bodyText:
Since there's nothing really specific to changing passwords in this filter, let's instead call it RequestMatcherRedirectFilter. We'd also want to move it to web in that case.
I imagine the constructor would change to take both a RequestMatcher and a redirect location.
Since this would now be a more generic filter, I think we should also remove it from the FilterComparator and instead have the DSL use addFilterBefore.
timeline.author: jzheaux

replies.bodyText: @jzheaux I did the same refactoring for the WebFilter.
replies.author: evgeniycheban

timeline.bodyText: Let's please remove this. If necessary, we can always add it later on.
timeline.author: jzheaux

+	 * 	@Override

+	 * 		http
+	 * 			.authorizeRequests(authorizeRequests ->
+	 * 				authorizeRequests
+	 * 					.antMatchers("/**").hasRole("USER")
+	 * 			)
+	 * 			.passwordManagement();
+	 *    }
+	 * }
+	 *
+ * + * @return the {@link PasswordManagementConfigurer} for further customizations + * @throws Exception + * @since 5.4 + */ + public PasswordManagementConfigurer passwordManagement() throws Exception {
